page.title: 03WOOTTON HALL - Wootton Wawen
page.content:
Wootton Hall was built in 1687. It is built of stone and has a former Roman Catholic chapel nearby. The Hall has had many owners and its history includes references to Mrs. Fitzherbert and George IV.
The present owner has converted part of the grounds into a Mobile Home Park. The Hall and chapel building are now used for residential purposes, as a country club and for dances and entertainment.
The River Alne flows through the grounds, feeding pools used for leisure purposes. A large heronry is well-established.
